key_title: Key to the species of Logania

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Loganiaceae

source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Loganiaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Conn, B.J. (1999). Loganiaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lower surface of leaf-lamina densely papillose
Lower surface of leaf-lamina glabrous or variously hairy, never just papillose
Leaves more or less flat, usually more than 20 mm long and 1.5 mm wide; apex usually apiculate
Leaves revolute, usually c. 10 mm long, mature leaves less than 1.5 mm wide; apex obtuse to acute
Leaf-base attenuate, somewhat decurrent; lamina linear to very narrowly elliptic, length-to-width ratio (5–) 10; leaf-margin not thickened, more or less flat
Leaf-base rounded to slightly cuneate; lamina broadly ovate to ovate, rarely narrowly ovate, length-to-width ratio 1.2–2.5 (–3.5); leaf-margin slightly thickened and slightly recurved
